comments.body:
Instead of leaving the wrong information, and then putting in an addendum correcting it, can you just fix the text?

![be_bold svg](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/609896/812862/38846eaa-eef7-11e2-987d-5c4ee1020e9b.png)

Maybe change "Five of the scalar types..." to "Some of the scalar types...", and then in the table say

```
:class:`IntType` (Python 2 only)
```

?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +93,97 @@   The :class:`int_` type does **not** inherit from the
   :class:`int` built-in under Python 3, because type :class:`int` is no
   longer a fixed-width integer type.

.. tip:: The default data type in Numpy is :class:`float_`.
